commit message:
Initial commit.

Able to take screenshots, but only of itself for now. Works perfectly on the
Droid; color is off on the N1.
Added GPL v2.

Added comprehension of pixel formats.

Should work on arbitrary devices now.
Added an icon. The stock one feels cheap.
Fixed a segfault due to an insufficient buffer.
Added simple config UI and camera button trigger.
Added acceleration trigger.

Fixed another segfault in the native code.

This one only appeared when compiling with debuggable set to false.

Changed where toasts confirming screenshots happen.

Refactored takeScreenshot to require a context in which to toast. Having that
function static may be entirely wrong, but for now, this is an improvement.
Refactored out unnecessary setters.
Added timestamped filenames inside of /sdcard/screenshots.
Converted away from static code to something more like a proper Android service.
Fixed filename generation so it pads all fields properly.
Add JNI_OnLoad function to native code.
Add on-screen printout of FB params for debugging.
Notify the media server when we take a screenshot. New ones should show up in the gallery now.
Version releases and up priority on receiving the camera button.
Add dox.
Update AndroSSNative.java.

Add android.util.Base64 from the Gingerbread source. Target API lvl 7.

Base64 wasn't introduced until API lvl 8, so just copying the one class makes it
possible to target lvl 7 and possibly lower.
Fix old assumption about bytes per pixel.
Use octal notation for chmod instead of symbolic for better compatibility.

Complete overhaul of program state. Use SharedPreferences like we're supposed to.

Vastly better handling of configuration that should allow the components to play
much more nicely together. Also, change filtering of sensor events so multiple
screenshots for a single shake of the phone are much less likely.
Add three compression options and better instrumentation for runtime.
Cleanup registerNewScreenshot().
Release v0.1.
